Summary: Stomach concerns, like gastric cancer or peptic ulcers, are diagnosed and treated by a gastroenterologist. Read more about common stomach disorders.

The majority of people have experienced stomach nausea or diarrhea at some point over the course of their lives. This may happen after consuming a meal or at some time during any given day. In any case, recurring abdominal discomfort or bowel urgency might indicate that meeting with a Jackson, MS gastroenterologist is in order. At GI Associates & Endoscopy Center, our experienced team of specialists is here to help you get some relief from stomach troubles.

How many people are affected by stomach problems?

An estimated 10 – 15% of U.S. adults are affected by abdominal pain, per the American College of Gastroenterology. Though you might think a slight belly ache or grumbling is nothing of concern, it's important to become familiar with the different forms of stomach illnesses and diseases, and their symptoms and signs, so you can identify potential concerns. Our gastrointestinal specialists at GI Associates & Endoscopy Center are eager to assist you with treatment options that can improve your discomfort.

What are common stomach concerns to watch out for?

Numerous digestive disorders can have similar symptoms and signs. Visiting a gastrointestinal physician is an imperative step that could keep your digestive tract happy, healthy, and properly maintained throughout your lifetime. Stomach issues commonly experienced often exhibit very similar signs and symptoms, which include loose stools, aching or burning pain in the abdominal area, nausea, and vomiting, bloating, feeling full after eating a small amount, and heartburn. If you’ve experienced chronic discomfort, stomach issues that you're unable to alleviate, or a burning or aching sensation, it's imperative to get treatment for stomach issues in Jackson, MS to preserve your health and wellness. Some common stomach conditions include the following:

Gastroparesis

Gastritis

Peptic ulcers

Gastric (stomach) cancer

Non-ulcer dyspepsia

Gastroenteritis

Schedule a visit with the physicians at GI Associates & Endoscopy Center to get the proper treatment you need for your stomach concerns and get back to enjoying life in comfort.

When is treatment necessary for stomach issues?

In the event non-prescription medicines are no longer alleviating your symptoms, and you've had persistent discomfort or constant bowel habits that are unusual, we urge you to meet with a GI doctor. Gastroenterologists are trained to help individuals return to normal function and health of everything from the esophagus down to the stomach, pancreas, liver, and colon. Their profound expertise allows them to treat and manage a multitude of stomach conditions, ranging from stomach ulcers to gastroenteritis.

Though treatment approaches for stomach problems and diseases can vary, they will generally start with an assessment of your symptoms and move forward from that point. Consulting our specialized team is the initial step to getting relief from your stomach issues.
